metadata.feature_description: Integrates Bootstrap responsive grid system for column layouts.

steps.action: Navigated to Home page and enabled Edit Mode to view Content Layout modules
steps.expected: Bootstrap CSS stylesheet should be loaded on the page
steps.actual: Bootstrap CSS is loaded from /DesktopModules/DnnCorp/ContentLayout/Css/bootstrap.min.css. JavaScript evaluation confirmed bootstrapStylesheetLoaded: true

steps.action: Verified Bootstrap CSS file contains responsive grid classes namespaced under .dnn-cl
steps.expected: CSS file should contain Bootstrap grid classes (col-lg-*, col-md-*, col-sm-*, col-xs-*)
steps.actual: Bootstrap CSS contains full grid system with responsive breakpoints at 768px, 992px, and 1200px, all namespaced under .dnn-cl class

steps.expected: 4-column layout should display with columns side by side
steps.actual: 4-column layout displayed correctly with TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS in a row using col-lg-3 classes (25% width each)

steps.expected: Columns should remain side by side with col-md-3 classes
steps.actual: 4-column layout maintained at 992px width - columns narrower but still side by side

steps.action: Used JavaScript evaluation to inspect column CSS classes on Content Layout panes
steps.expected: Panes should have Bootstrap grid classes (col-lg-*, col-md-*, col-sm-*, col-xs-12)
steps.actual: Verified 8 panes with Bootstrap column classes. Example: F30A_Pane1 has 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12'. Code in ColumnSizesHelper.cs generates these classes based on layout configuration.

steps.action: Verified .dnn-cl namespace class is applied to parent containers
steps.expected: Parent containers should have .dnn-cl class to scope Bootstrap styles
steps.actual: Found 3 elements with .dnn-cl class on the page, correctly scoping Bootstrap styles to prevent conflicts with other page CSS

steps.expected: Columns should stack vertically at full width (100%) due to col-xs-12 class
steps.actual: Columns correctly stacked to full width on mobile. Navigation collapsed to 'Menu' button. Each product category (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS) now takes 100% width and stacks vertically.

steps.action: Scrolled down to verify stacked column layout on mobile
steps.expected: All columns should be stacked vertically in sequence
steps.actual: Confirmed vertical stacking: TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS each displayed at full width in sequence

steps.action: Verified respond.min.js file exists in codebase and is injected via conditional comments
steps.expected: respond.js polyfill should be present for IE8 media query support
steps.actual: respond.min.js (v1.4.2) exists at ContentLayout/ClientScripts/respond.min.js. Code in View.ascx.cs InjectRespondJsForIE8() method injects it via conditional comment: <!--[if IE 8]><script src='ClientScripts/respond.min.js'></script><![endif]-->

steps.action: Used JavaScript evaluation to confirm respond.js reference in page header
steps.expected: Page header should contain respond.min.js reference
steps.actual: Confirmed hasRespondJsInHeader: true. Script is wrapped in IE conditional comment so it only loads in IE8 browsers (as expected).

observations: Bootstrap CSS is customized and namespaced under .dnn-cl class to prevent style conflicts with existing site themes
The ColumnSizesHelper.cs generates Bootstrap column classes dynamically based on layout configuration (e.g., '25,25,25' generates col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12 for 4-column layouts)
respond.js polyfill is only loaded for IE8 browsers via conditional comments - this is correct behavior for legacy browser support
In Edit Mode, additional styling is applied for the layout editor UI, but Bootstrap grid classes remain applied and functional
